intro: Erlangea laxa, commonly known as the slender erlangia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Due to its unique adaptations, Erlangea laxa is well-suited for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
